title: Justification with the Extreme Value Theorem

content.prompt: The function f is defined for all x in the closed interval [ a ,   b ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@ If f does not attain a maximum value on [ a ,   b ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@ , If f does not attain a maximum value on which of the following must be true?

choices.label: f is not continuous on [ a ,   b ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@ .

f is not bounded on [ a ,   b ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@ .

f does not attain a minimum value on [ a ,   b ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@ .

The graph of f has a vertical asymptote in the interval [ a ,   b ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@ .
